newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swissair Jan-Aug cargo traffic up 6.4 pc.
newsitem.headline: Swissair Jan-Aug cargo traffic up 6.4 pc.

text.p: Swissair said cargo shipments transported in the first eight months of 1996 totalled 1.05 billion freight tonne kilometres FTK, up 6.4 percent on the same period last year..

Ex-Switzerland-Far East cargo routes (excluding Japan) achieved the biggest growth of the airline's seven cargo traffic regions, up 25.1 percent on January-August 1995 at 333.4 million FTK, Swissair figures showed.
For Swissair, this region includes destinations such as Bangkok, Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai, Seoul and Manila, as well as destinations in India and Pakistan.
Cargo volumes transported between Switzerland and Japan fell by 8.9 percent on the first eight months of 1995 to 72.7 million FTK.

North American routes showed 2.1 percent growth on the same period last year to 438.2 million FTK while South America tabled an increase of 17.8 percent on the same period last year to 34.5 million FTK.
As in previous months, European traffic suffered from the reduced cargo capacity of the Airbus fleet with volume down 11.7 percent on January-August 1995 at 39.1 million FTK, the airline said.
Cargo traffic in January-August 1996, expressed in million FTK, with percentage change on January-August 1995, was as follows:
